website_summaries.verdict: This inexpensive pick is a solid choice for leisurely backpackers and outdoor enthusiasts.
pros: Great for temperatures down to 35°F, but can also work down to 20°F
Weighs only 2.8 pounds with mummy design
cons: Many customers wish the zipper was higher quality
Not the best option for taller users

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, Warm, Fitting!
customer_reviews.text: This review is for the Mummy Sleeping Bag colored orange. This is perfect for camping. It is really light weight and fit right in my pack. It was able to be strapped under or on top of the pack as well. As for the temperature, it keeps you very warm. I had to open up the easy to zip zipper to cool down in 35°f weather. Packing and rolling it up is a cake walk. The bag also has straps to shrink down the bag ever more to make more room for other things. The orange color can signal others in case of an emergency. I love everything about this sleeping bag. Thanks again!
customer_reviews.author: Keith Alcantara

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, warm and comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered 2 of these for a recent trip to Havasu (spring). They were very warm and actually I slept in it unzipped. The weather didn't go too low so I didn't get to test their resiliance in the cold. However, they were light and easy to pack and unpack and very comfortable. Zippers seemed high quality and easy to operate. My only quibble is that they are a bit narrow and I found myself wanting a little more width, but all in all, for the cost these seem to be great. The cinch sack that comes in addition to the compression sack is great and I was able to compress this sucker pretty small. Great.
customer_reviews.author: Feaster

customer_reviews.title: Misleading product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item because the description says satisfaction guaranteed, and no return necessary for a refund if you don't like the product. I bought it, tried it out, and it didn't work for me. The zippers snag constantly. It's very difficult to return to the pouch after rolling up. I figured I'd donate it and request a refund. Neither Amazon or the seller directly will allow this. ,The description still says (as of 1/15) that no return is necessary for a refund. I recycled the packaging when it came because of this, so I don't have the means to return it - at least not without paying for it myself. Truly surprised Amazon would allow this to happen.
customer_reviews.author: Evan MacIsaac

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: I bought this sleeping bag for my backpacking trip through Sequoia National Park. My first night out, the zipper came off the track and could not be put back on. So I was in 30 degree weather outdoors for the next couple of nights with a broken sleeping bag. Buyers be aware. You've heard it before and you're hearing it again: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product.
customer_reviews.text: The bag is too short for a grown adult. At 6'6" this bag is pretty much useless. The zipper broke on the first attempt to open. The double zipper seems to be installed wrong making it impossible to re zip. You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Starr

customer_reviews.title: Really impressed for the cost. I used this in ...
customer_reviews.text: Really impressed for the cost. I used this in tandem with a hammock and 40F rated underquilt. In clear/quiet weather and under shade at 28F outside, I was sweating while wearing my hoodie and long johns in the hammock with this set up and was blown away. The materials are lightweight and well constructed, can be machine washed and comes with a 5 year warranty. I will be coming back to these guys for more equipment for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Austin S

customer_reviews.title: very upsetting
customer_reviews.text: bought this for a 2 and a half week road trip camping every day. the zipper completely broke on me not even into the second week of the trip. worked well when the zipper worked because it got very cold at night, but once the zipper broke there was no way for me to zip myself up so it was basically a blanket. very upsetting!
customer_reviews.author: maynard

customer_reviews.title: Very warm and comfortable, but not at 20F
customer_reviews.text: Build quality seems great for the price. Zippers are good, they don't snag. Foot room is generous. I tested this out in my backyard with my tent and sleeping pad as if I were backpacking. It was 25F and I wore only thin thermal pants/shirt. I sleep a little cold, so I wasn't able to make it though the night. The description says: "You'll feel comfortable when temperature is between 35F and 40F. But these are designed to keep the average sleeper warm even at near-freezing temperatures(20F)." 35-40F would definitely be comfortable, 30F would probably be okay. 20F *might* be doable with a bag liner, thermals, and gloves+socks+hat. In any case, you won't find any better value for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Alara

customer_reviews.title: Nearly froze at 39 degrees camping in a tent
customer_reviews.text: We bought two of these bags. First the good: The colors are bright! They came very nicely packaged. The zippers seem well made and the baffle is a really nice touch. We loved the compression sleeve. The bad: We camped out last night. Temperatures were in the 50s in the day, and down to 39 that night. We nearly froze! Even in a tent with sleeping pads, and a wool blanket underneath, the only we made it through the night was with another wool blanket on top. These are nice sleeping bags for the price, but I am disappointed about the temperature rating. May change my overall star rating depending on whether the manufacturer reaches out.
customer_reviews.author: Josh G

customer_reviews.title: Good overall sleeping bag, for tall person!
customer_reviews.text: I've only used this bag once so far but am happy with it. I bought it for backpacking and it's light enough for the type of weight I'm carrying at this point. I'm 6'1, 150 lbs and it's plenty long enough and roomy for me. Seems to be made well and I like the mummy shape. I like that it comes with the compression sack. Fun fact: never roll a sleeping bag again. I was today years old when I learned to literally 'stuff' the bag into your stuff sack (imagine that) and it fits like a dream and takes all of 10 seconds. No more trying to roll it and getting stressed when you're on the trail.
customer_reviews.author: Sis10

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and warm enough for temps above 45-50°F
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a budget bag for backpacking in cooler temps. I used it in about 45-50 degree weather and feel that's the limit of this bag. Any cooler and you should expect to be getting uncomfortably cold unless you put on more layers. The compression bag allows it to get pretty compact and is definitely a plus for saving space. My only complaint: the draw strings on the hood are right at face level, get in the way, and are annoying despite not even cinching the opening very well. Hopefully the manufacturer can move them downward or to another location that is out of the way.
customer_reviews.author: kylenetkyle

customer_reviews.title: Decent for the Price
customer_reviews.text: -Warm enough for fall or spring in the desert/low mountains. -Lightweight. -OK zippers. But... -I have to wrap mine with a strap or two to get it in the bag. Stuffing or trying to hold the roll by hand is difficult. -Outside material feels like slippery, thin foil. Inner material is OK, though. -The provided cinch cover was useless for me; the bag is barely big enough as is.
customer_reviews.author: SuperTurboExtraGnarly

customer_reviews.title: Great Bag!
customer_reviews.text: I got lucky and tent camped the day after Christmas in northern IN. Weather is so crazy, it was 60F during the day so I didn't even think about looking at the forecast for the next morning. Cold front moved in overnight and dropped to 32F and I felt nice and warm. I did use common sense and wore some thin long johns and socks to bed, and I have a light inner bag liner. I also had a 1/2" foam pad and an inflatable air mattress to insulate from the ground. This bag kept me comfortable, and is a good size too since I'm 6'2. Nice compression bag for storage too so it packs up tight.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: Back for a 2nd sleeping bag!
customer_reviews.text: My husband already had one of these sleeping bags. He’s used it on several hunts in remote locations in the US and Canada. It’s been a super durable, lightweight, and warm sleeping bag so we decided to get another one for an upcoming backpacking trip. We’ve been fine in these bags in as low as 35F. It comes with a small bag to put the sleeping bag in as well as a slightly larger durable waterproof bag, so if it doesn’t fit in your pack, you can easily connect it to your pack and not worry about it getting wet or damaged. For the price, this is a fantastic sleeping bag.
customer_reviews.author: Kitty Momma

customer_reviews.title: Not for backpacking
customer_reviews.text: I needed a new backpacking sleeping bag so I bought this because it was advertised for it. Compared to my older bag, this is about 3x as big and takes up a lot more space in my backpack. I was pretty bummed about that because I bought it specifically for backpacking. However, when I took it on an overnight campout, it held up great! There’s padding between you and the zipper, which prevents the zipper from slowly opening up on you throughout the night. Kept me pretty warm and cozy. So if you’re looking for a good bag not for backpacking, this is a great deal.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Zushi

customer_reviews.title: It performed beautifully; it's light
customer_reviews.text: Just took this on a 4 day backpacking trip because I needed something just as warm but lighter than my old sleeping bag. It performed beautifully; it's light, I had no problem getting into the smaller compression sack it comes with (did not use the larger one), and kept me comfortable at 10,000 feet. Temperatures didn't go to freezing, and on the coldest night (probably in the 40s) I kept my base layer on for added warmth, but that's fine by me. Zippers seem solid and didn't get caught overly often. Really like the mummy design.
customer_reviews.author: Bee Neuf

customer_reviews.title: Nice bag but not warm at all
customer_reviews.text: I used this for camping in Moab during late April. Weather sometimes got down to 40's but mostly in the 50's at night, maybe even early 60's, but this bag never felt warm. I'd wake up shivering most nights that I tried to just wear one layer of thermals. Had to put my fleece on to be comfortable, but then obviously you run the risk of getting too warm, especially in the morning. Size of the bag was good, and I like the hood feature, but definitely wouldn't recommend for anything but warm weather camping. The temperature rating is a joke. Should have returned it but I forgot
customer_reviews.author: Mr. O. R. Clark

customer_reviews.title: Rating is close to right, compression sack broke
customer_reviews.text: I used this bag at a Scouts BSA summer camp last week, and I shivered a few times with my hot chili’s and warm hiking sox on. I got up and put on my micro fleece to help keep work and it worked then, but seems like I wouldn’t need much on to meet the temp objective. After 2 uses, the strap broke off from the sewing on the compression bag. I’d like the vendor to offer to give me a new compression sack or exchange it.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Moss

customer_reviews.title: From 1 start, to 5 star!
customer_reviews.text: I was about to give this sack a 1 star review at first since it came in a bright baby blue pull string bag. I was not trilled at first, I pulled it out anyways and tried it on. Its warm as can be! It is going to be attached in my SHTF bag. I pulled out the sack and realized there was another item in the baby blue sack, which was my appropriately colored stuff sack. I wish it was just packaged in the corresponding color of the bag that you purchase, but overall a great bag
customer_reviews.author: Blinky

customer_reviews.title: Warm into the 30s.  Zipper a little problematic.
customer_reviews.text: Just came back from a trip in Yosemite. Purchased three of these to carry in hiking packs. They compress down to a size that allows them to easily fit in the packs and are reasonably light. They kept us warm with temps getting into the low 30s. The zipper on one of the bags broke the first time it was used and is not recoverable. The bag continued to work just fine but being able to zip it would have been better of course. Considering the price, the bag is still a good deal.
customer_reviews.author: Rich N.

customer_reviews.title: Just, meh.
customer_reviews.text: I was slightly disappointed, as it claims this is good for cooler weather. But I froze all night in the Tetons in early August-one of the warmest months of the year there. It got down to the high 40s at night. It is also absolutely massive and doesn’t roll up easily back into the smaller sack. But if you try REALLY hard, and need to save space, you can use it as a type of “stuff sack.” It is very affordable im comparison to bigger name brands, but I wouldn’t buy another one. The upside for some people is that it has a TON of legroom for a typical mummy bag. In my case, it was entirely too much.
customer_reviews.author: Kait

customer_reviews.title: Great service from seller
customer_reviews.text: I spent 5 nights in the sleeping bag but had trouble with the warmth. Granted, I used it in a hammock which I think makes it significantly colder, but I appreciated the mummy style (allowing me to cover my head and most of my face), the fit (not too tight anywhere), and ease of packing it up every morning. I'm 6' 2" 185lbs and the sleeping bag fit me perfectly. Because of the warmth issue, I contacted the seller who graciously offered to make it up to me. I was impressed with their service and would buy from them again.
customer_reviews.author: P. Roth

customer_reviews.title: Low 50's in Zion National Park
customer_reviews.text: We did the West Rim trail with an overnight stop. It got down into the low 50's overnight. I slept in a hammock and only wore shorts and a long sleeve shirt. I was comfortable and even had to unzip the bag at points. It was light weight and packed really well. The next night we camped on BLM land and had a short rain storm, about 5 minutes. The bag stayed dry and I didn't even bother putting up a rainfly. After backpacking 15+ miles in the middle of Utah, it was great to be able to lay down warm and dry.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Brown

customer_reviews.title: Best sleeping bag I've ever owned!!!
customer_reviews.text: I had first learned about this brand "Winner Outfitters" a few years back when I decided to purchase one of their hammocks.. (which of course I was incredibly pleased with not only the hammock; but the company's customer service) So when I learned that they also made sleeping bags; I did not hesitate. I opened the box and was once again pleased with the quality of the item. From the color to the carrying case all of it is quality made and I am very pleased once again with another purchase from "Winner Outfitters" I'm a now a customer for life!
customer_reviews.author: Rachael V

customer_reviews.title: 35-40 degrees  (True to rating)
customer_reviews.text: I took this on a hiking trip - its small and light. Night # 1 Weather: 29 Degrees - Windy Clothes: Base Layer, Sweatpants, Pull-over sweatshirt. Winter socks. Other: Cheap polyester sleeping bag liner Cheap hikers sleeping pad (air) Result: I pretty much froze my butt off. Night #2 Weather: 37 degrees no wind Result: Perfectly comfortable! This bag will work good if you dress well for 35-40 degrees. 100%
customer_reviews.author: Tywang

customer_reviews.title: Warm, comfy, affordable.
customer_reviews.text: To start i an a make 6,3 240lbs 38 waist. This sleeping bag is snug but i can fit in it comfortable. Wish i had a grew extra inches bit it isn't bad. The zipper is questionable, it has jammed a number of times since i have received it. I washed and dried it with no shrinkage. It is warm, though would never use it in very cold weather. Well updated after i take it backpacking, but my first impression is that it isn't bad for the price.
customer_reviews.author: josh

customer_reviews.title: Great Deal
customer_reviews.text: This bag was a great value. I am 6' and 210 pounds with wide shoulders. I was worried the bag would be too narrow but it fits just right. There is room to still move around. It came with two bags, one compression and one regular. It looks great and I can't wait to try it out on my overnight bike packing trip. We all know there are more expensive better quality bags out there, but unless you camp out for a living why spend the extra money. I would recommend this bag and am going to buy another for the wife.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Mummy sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: I received the Winner Outfitters mummy sleeping bag and the quality appears to be good, no open seams or threads hanging and the stitching seems well done. I haven't used it outdoors yet but did open it and slip into to check size and it is roomy enough for me at 5'11" and 200lb. It is very light weight and the size when compressed is reasonable, I had no problem stuffing it back into its sack after folding and rolling it. I don't think you can beat the price.
customer_reviews.author: Thothb

customer_reviews.title: Great mummy bag for a great price!
customer_reviews.text: We tried out this mummy bag this past weekend while camping at Bryce Canyon National Park. It worked perfectly for what we needed. It's lightweight and a nice bright color; it rolls up small and comes in a functional bag that we easily clipped onto our packs. My 6 year old used it the first night when temperatures dipped to 40-degrees and she said she was "Hot"! My husband used it the second night when it dipped to 35-degrees and said he was relatively warm. My husband is 5'11" and was touching the bottom of the bag, so it's probably better for the less tall people. Overall, a great buy and look forward to using it a lot this summer!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Good for new campers!
customer_reviews.text: I actually used it this labor day weekend and i really liked it! I actually got a bit warm in it in 50 degree weather so I unzipped the side and I was fine! I would prefer to be a little too warm in the hotter months sleeping and have a sleeping bag that will keep me warm in the colder months. The thing I preferred most about the sleeping bag was how compact it is when its in compression sack. It was super easy to tote around and lightweight. Will say, had some issues getting it back into the compression sack the first time around. Love the orange color I chose as well!
customer_reviews.author: sarah

customer_reviews.title: kept me warm
customer_reviews.text: Does it's job which is to keep me warm, but I wish it had some sort of hooks or strings to keep it folded and rolled up while I'm stuffing it in the sack. Without those items it almost requires an extra hand or two to hold it so it doesn't unroll and expand. My Coleman bags all have these features, unfortunately they're far too large for backpacking but the features I'm asking for wouldn't add any volume to the bag.
customer_reviews.author: J Schmidt

customer_reviews.title: I was still cold
customer_reviews.text: I used this sleeping bag while camping in one tent with three other people in the Patagonian summer (still gets to the 30s and 40s at night) and I was still freezing. I went to sleep with long layers on and had to add on another layer to stop shivering. I often had to sleep with my head completely covered, which made the built in pillow kind of useless. I wouldn't use this sleeping bag again in weather below 50 degrees. However, it did roll back up nicely into its original size and shape and the material felt nice. If you start to sweat in the sleeping bag the water resistance kind of cooks you lol.
customer_reviews.author: Maria Rubiano

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: We bought 6 when they were on the lightning deal, 2 of the heavier, wider ones and 4 of the lighterweight ones. For dirt haters like me, the "tent" attachment that keeps the opening protected is a cool feature that I have never seen before. We have only opened the heavier one so far, but it's substantial, feels very warm, and designed well. The double-sided zipper works fine. I do think the stitching could have been done a tad bit better, but we aren't planning to do really heavy-duty camping so I think this should work fine. And the price point really cannot be beat.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Zipper Immediately Broke
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to give this sleeping bag five stars... the package was lightweight, neat, not too large, and perfect for backpacking. It was really warm and comfortable too; however, it broke within about 5 minutes. I unzipped the sleeping bag (gently) to get in, and once I got in I tried to zip it up but realized it was already broken. Disappointed, to say the least, but I'm going to exchange it and update my review once I find out whether the product was defective or just poor quality. For a product that boasts a "quality" zipper in its description, not too impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Ben P.

customer_reviews.title: survived Iceland!
customer_reviews.text: so i took this with me to Iceland 9/27/18-10/5/18 weather ranged from 20 degrees to 40 degrees at night and i was warm and toasty. this is iceland we are talking about, i slept in a hyundai tucson at campsites with the wind rocking the car and nights where it rain and snow and we were at -1 degrees Celsius. compressing sleeping bags are no fun but doable and i was able to fit it into the designated area on my hiking backpack teton. a great buy at a great price. i was impressed with how toasty i was when all the way in it.
customer_reviews.author: Brittani

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t keep out all the cold
customer_reviews.text: Okay so for a budget bag, this sleeping bag isn’t failing me much at all. Overall I’d say I camp in a lot colder conditions than most and have unfortunately been very cold in this bag before, but for a summer/fall bag, it does great. A bit too large for backpacking. But it’s a great buy for the price. If I could recommend this to my friends or family, I’d say spend a bit more money for a warmer, more compatible bag. But it definitely works for the time being!
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Terrific value
customer_reviews.text: I'm a volunteer firefighter and bought this for use during overnight duty shifts at the fire station...I'm 6'2" and 290 lbs and the bag fits me snugly but comfortably. It's very lightweight and fits into the stuff sack without taking up much space in storage in the back of my vehicle...particularly considering the price, this is a terrific value. n.b. The product comes with both a 'normal' stuff sack (which is sufficiently compact for me and I expect, most people) and also a compression sack for backpackers and others where space is a premium. The stuff sack has ripped after a few uses...I have contacted the seller about a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander U. Conrad

customer_reviews.title: Good deal
customer_reviews.text: Good size and good weight, feels pretty good quality for the price. The sleeping bag comes packed tightly in a bag and that bag is packed inside the carrying bag. For the life of me I couldn't get the sleeping bag to get back into the internal bag (and it was a pain to get out to start with), but it fits easily into the carrying bag. The four strap packing system keeps it small and snug, and looks like it'll keep it plenty dry even without the internal bag.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Chutuk

customer_reviews.title: Great versatile lightweight 3-4 season bag fantastic deal
customer_reviews.text: This bag is a spring/summer/fall and winter(depending on climate) backpackers dream. The zipper design will allow you to cool off on hot nights and stay warm on cool nights by having 2 zippers one at the bottom and one at the top to allow ventilation at night. The bag weighs nothing and the fill is extremely comfortable and soft. I will be buying another for my wife. I wanted to try it out first. This is now the 2nd bag I bought because of the quality in design and performance. Save some money and get just as high quality of a bag as the so-called name brands and get this bag. You won’t be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Buc

customer_reviews.title: Great value sleeping bag!
customer_reviews.text: Great sleeping bad for the price! We bought this for a few day honking trip. It is light weight and compact but not so compact it is a ball I prefer a bag that can be strapped to an external frame if necessary. It also include a waterproof compression sack if you want to squish it into a ball you probably could. It’s also very long and think the material of the bag is probably also water resistant! We bought one and now I wish I had bought two!
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: freezing
customer_reviews.text: went backpacking with this bag and it was 25 degrees F at night. Wearing long underwear, two pairs of pants, two long sleeve shirts, two coats, gloves, two pairs of socks, and a balaclava hat, all on top of a sleep pad, I was freezing. The kicker is that this bag doesn't unzip all the way to the foot box. This makes it practically impossible to zip my bag together with another person's to share in their warmth. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Huffman

customer_reviews.title: Good bag for the price
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this is a great bag. Definitely packs down small and is lightweight. Was concerned at first that it would not keep warm in cold weathethat it would not keep warm in low temperatures as advertised. Material is very is thinner then my higher quality bag rated for higher temperatures. However, it proved to keep warm enough at 50°. I don't believe I would depend upon it lower than 45° though. As other reviewers have stated, I would have liked 4 straps on the compression sack (instead of 3), however, with the included additional bag, it still packs down very tight and small.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for Kayak Camping!
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased this bag because I couldn't pass up the features and low price. I generally stick to more common camping brands but I needed and inexpensive and compact sleeping bag to fit in my kayak. When I received this, I was very happy to see how small it was with its included compression sack. I did not get to test out the lower temperature limits in this bag yet. But the quality and comfort are both excellent and I have no doing this will perform as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Very Warm, Good Fill, Long Length.
customer_reviews.text: These are fantastic sleeping bags. Well made zippers with internal pulls that do not snag. I am 6'4" and was initially worried about length and hood compatibility with my height—This is no issue. They are plenty long and very warm. After removing from the compression sack the bag fluffs up nicely and is extremely cozy. I didn't even need a pillow with the hood. Very happy with this purchase. My only complaint is that it is somewhat difficult to get the bag down to a small size in a backpacking unit. Takes some muscle to compress down to a manageable size, but this is worth the extra effort and pack weight in terms of warmth, comfort. and price.
customer_reviews.author: Sauks

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to give this a 5 star review but can't do it based on the temperature rating of this bag. A recent trip to Red River Gorge had temperatures that hovered low 40's and upper 30's overnight. I froze. I slept in thermals, full clothes and a jacket the second night. I wouldn't use this sleeping bag in in temperatures below 50 degrees. The quality seems very good and I don't have any complaints about the stuff sack. I will use this bag during the warmer months.
customer_reviews.author: toledodad

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied for Fall Camping
customer_reviews.text: I'm really happy with this purchase. We bought it for my 7 and 4 year olds for a Cub Scout camping trip in November, and temperatures dipped down into the 30s. The bags were warm. Neither of the boys woke, and they definitely didn't want to crawl out in the morning. They were both satisfied with the warmth, but I don't think it was so heavy it would cause issues in warmer weather. The bags fold easily and are lightweight and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: small size, lightweight, waterproof, and warm.
customer_reviews.text: took to the boundary waters in early summer. was warm enough, was dry in the rain. in fact, it was the driest bag in the tent so they made her sleep by the edge of the tent where the rain came in a little and the bag was still dry. comes with two sizes of stuff sacks, regular and microscopic. used the regular one (small) because the other one was difficult to get the bag back into. super bag. highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: A Barrett

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service.
customer_reviews.text: I found this sleeping bag slept a bit too cold for the type of camping I generally do. I was going to review this lower than 5 stars because of that but Winner Outfitters' customer service gave me a full refund and let me keep the bag. Now I have a sleeping bag for the other seasons and can put this money toward a more robust (and expensive) sleeping bag...which I will buy from Winner Outfitters if one meeting my specifications is available. This is a no financial risk purchase and a no-brainer if you're in the market for a sleeping bag.
customer_reviews.author: Russ Gadoury

customer_reviews.title: Zipper broke in 2 days
customer_reviews.text: Update: The zipper broke only the 2nd time I unzipped it while testing it in my living room. :( Original Review: I am feeling ambivalent about this sleeping bag. The price is good and it seems comfortable enough. The only thing is that the main color is not really vibrant organelle, but copper or liver. Looks dull and joyless. It is not feather, so there is no give. It is difficult to pack, but for the price and the lightweight, you really cannot ask for more.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Great Bag for the Money -Accurate Temp Rating
customer_reviews.text: Used this bag this weekend starting at 30 deg and it got all the way down to 10. Wearing light base layer, light pants, a light hoodie, and wool socks, and on a good winter pad it was very comfortable down to 25. At 20, I added a bag liner that claims to give another 15 deg of capability. It did and I was ok down to 10 deg. Great bag for the money. I have two of them and both of us had the same experience on this trip.
customer_reviews.author: Skabo

customer_reviews.title: Great bag for the money
customer_reviews.text: Great bag for the money! Even though it has the compression sack, it didn't work too well for me. It doesn't compress down fery small and makes the sack all lumpy and irregular and hard to pack. So I didn't even use the compression sack. I bought two of these. One in the Olive and one in dark blue. They kept us real warm on a 40 degree night and again on a 38 degree night with a rainstorm. We didn't get wet either. Great value here.
customer_reviews.author: KennyfnPowers

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality zipper
customer_reviews.text: My son used this for camp and when he returned home he said the zipper was broken. He told me every one at camp tried to fix it. Now when I worked on it, a half hour later I was able to get it to work. I feel it is just too wonky for kids to be able to deal with. Since it was a long camp I am now too late to return the sleeping bag even though they say they will accept returns no questions asked. Maybe they still can, I don't know, but Amazon tells me it is too late. Oh well.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. John F. Mccleary

customer_reviews.title: High end performance and Quality Comparable to Much Higher Priced Equivalents
customer_reviews.text: Son needed a new sleeping bag after a growth spurt made him outgrow his previous bag. We wanted one that was very compact for backpacking yet still offered warmth and padding as well as durability. The reviews we read stated that this was a good purchase and we trusted them. We are glad we did since the bag has been wonderful during the trips he has taken and will be great for his Philmont Trek this summer.
customer_reviews.author: AmnzFan

customer_reviews.title: WINNER OUTFITTERS Mummy Sleeping Bag with Compression Sack olive/green/kaki
customer_reviews.text: This review is for the WINNER OUTFITTERS Mummy Sleeping Bag with Compression Sack. I bought this for camping and needed something for the cold weather. I received it in perfect condition and loved the quality and feel of the sleeping bag. It is really light weight and packs small so it doesn’t take up a lot of room. It keeps you very warm. I love how easy it was to pack up and fit easily back in the sack that is included. The bag also has straps to shrink down the bag ever more to make more room for other things. I love everything about this sleeping bag. The olive/green/kaki color is awesome too.
customer_reviews.author: Darren Doud

customer_reviews.title: Warm and light
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to try it out so I took it on a quick two night trip and it worked great. The low temps were mid 40’s and I had no issues with being cold. It’s lightweight and it fit into the backpack pocket on my pack with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: This bag is great. Zippers are smooth and it's warm and comfortable. Only con is that the bag is a little tough to roll. It has 2 sleeves, and it can take a little work to get it in the first sleeve. But it's not enough of an issue to knock any points off for me.
customer_reviews.author: KaraE

customer_reviews.title: Light weight and super soft!
customer_reviews.text: We really enjoy the light weight yet comfy quality of this sleeping bag. It is easy to roll up and fits perfectly in the case that was provided with it. It is extremely convenient that the user can unzip part of the side in order to vent out excess heat. This will be perfect for someone like me who runs hot all the time. Combine this with a nice sleeping pad and you will be good to go! We can't wait to use this out in the field soon!
customer_reviews.author: ZUser

customer_reviews.title: Great sleeping bag, A little thick, Does well in cold
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for the wife. It didn’t pack down as well as I was hoping, but was very comfortable. We slept in 35 degrees with the wind of a waterfall next to us and my wife said she was warm except for her feet. She didn’t use a thermarest which I think was the problem. Overall good product. I think this could manage under freezing if you’re wearing thermals and have a good thermal pad under you.
customer_reviews.author: colby

customer_reviews.title: Husband said it’s warm but constricting
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for husband in preparation for a family camping trip. Needed to replace older sleeping bags. Husband said it’s warm but constricting—he’s not used to the mummy style bag. He feels the bottom section hear the feet should have a zipper to let air in if needed. In the end, though, after testing it out before the camping trip, the bag performed well for him.
customer_reviews.author: sd

customer_reviews.title: Great buy for the price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bag to fit in my pack for an overnight hike. I was worried as it was not a stuff bag but it rolled back up and was not hard to deal with at all. I love the weight and the cost was amazing for the quality and size! If in cold weather may want warmer but this was perfect for a summer evening ' evenbunzipped to cool down! And I'm usually a cold person.
customer_reviews.author: JoanL

customer_reviews.title: Amazing, especially for the price
customer_reviews.text: Material is surprisingly high quality. I have not had to test the lower end of its temperature range, but it is very comfortable. The material feels nice to the touch. I am 6ft tall and it fits my body perfectly even with my sleeping pad inside. Zippers and build quality seem solid. It is small when compressed, but that is one of the trade-offs with the price, both the overall size and weight. But again, for the price, it is a no-brainer.
customer_reviews.author: shadowgummy

customer_reviews.title: Great 3 season mummy bag!
customer_reviews.text: Large, with plenty of room inside, but packs down pretty small and light. Of course you can get smaller or lighter ones, but not even close to this price, so this is a good compromise and good value for the occasional use. Recently slept in it cowboy-camping with an inflatable ground mat in 42F clear night, and was very warm and comfortable. Almost got a better sleep than in my bed! I'm a restless sleeper, and this bag had plenty of room inside for me to roll around while still keeping the hood cinched up tight.
customer_reviews.author: KG101

customer_reviews.title: Not meant for the clostrophobic
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this 1 sleeping bag rather than the three comforters I usually have during the NYC winters. But take note that this mummy-style sleeping bag is not a good fit if you are the least bit claustrophobic. Easy to toss in the laundry, packs well, super warm. UPDATE 03/20/2020 Zipper broke after 3 months. and no way to fix it. Incredibly disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: James NYC

customer_reviews.title: For the price, can't complain
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't use this bag if you get much below 40 degrees. In conjunction with a sleeping pad, I used it when it was about 35, raining, and windy, and while I was able to sleep a sufficient amount, I did find myself waking up due to the cold occasionally. I wore pants and a long sleeve shirt as well. However, if you're not in the rain and wind, I could see it working better. Still, for the price, I'm very pleased with this sleeping bag.
customer_reviews.author: Austin Schultz

customer_reviews.title: Best budget backpacking sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: I just started backpacking and I can't afford the expensive down quilts. I was looking for a sleeping bag that can pack down as small as possible and be as light as possible. For the price there's no other sleeping bags out there that can beat this bag. I ordered one and loved it so much I bought 2 more for my wife and 7 year old. THIS IS the best entry level sleeping bag for backpacking. I kept super warm too!
customer_reviews.author: Rafael

customer_reviews.title: So slippery
customer_reviews.text: I tried to set up camp on the flattest surface I could find. It must have been on the slightest incline though because I kept slipping to the bottom of my bag. And the bag kept trying to slide to one side of the tent. I felt like I was in a slippery, spiraling, straight jacket. It was miserable. If you are a better camper than I am, you probably have ways to counter this problem. I don’t necessarily think this is a flaw of the product- it could very well be a flaw with me.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Not for 35 degrees
customer_reviews.text: Yeah no way this would be good @ 35- 40 degrees. ... you would be better off with a just a wool blanket. Which would pack into about the same amount of space. I used it the other night @ 60 degrees and it was 'ok' . I wasn't cold (long sleeve tee and pants) but I wasn't overly warm either. Which to me would be a good sign of a sleeping bag. It does pack pretty small (but once again about the size of a wool blanket) and is definitely light weight. Just better layer up on a 35 degree night
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ignore temp rating, don't use below 65 degrees
customer_reviews.text: This bag is light weight and packs down very small. But it is nothing close to a 35 degree bag. Maybe a 65 degree bag. Bought it for a backpacking trip where we knew it would be down to 40. Got one for my wife and one for me. We both froze our butts off. We even planned ahead and bought liners but it was not good enough. Ignore the temp rating. It is a classic mummy bag design so it is tight around the shoulders, hips, and legs. The zipper is only a 2/3 zipper.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew R.

customer_reviews.title: It will not keep you warm whatsoever.
customer_reviews.text: I had to wear under armor, rain coat, scarf, and hat on top of my normal hiking clothes in order to feel even somewhat insulated with this sleeping bag in 35-50 degree outdoor weather. I would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Derek Bagwell

customer_reviews.title: Great Sleeping Bag!
customer_reviews.text: Overall, no issue with the sleeping bag. I used it repeatedly in my tent when nights dipped down to below 40 degrees F and never had any issues being cold. I never had any problems with the zipper and feel that it is a quality product. The compression bag works very well at reducing the bag so it would fit in my pack's sleeping bag compartment. However, the bag originally came in a small black carrying bag that then went inside the compression bag. I've never been able to get the sleeping bag back into that tiny black bag, but it works just fine in the compression bag only.
customer_reviews.author: Kirk Parrott

customer_reviews.title: Decent quality
customer_reviews.text: I've only used this on one hike so far, temps were in the low 40's, but this and my hammock underquilt kept me quite warm. The quality seems pretty good so far, the zipper has some fabric next to it to prevent the bag material from getting caught up in it and that helps a lot. The compression sack works well and the weight seems reasonable, although I didn't actually weigh it. All in all I'm happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: N. Edgar

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I got this to camp in Kauai. I haven't gone yet, but I have slept in the sleeping bag! My house is freezing cold and I'm too cheap to turn on the heater, so I sleep in the sleeping bag. It works great, keeps me warm and is comfortable. My zipper doesn't catch like how other reviews say. You must zip it a certain way, but my zipper works fine. I'm also 5'2 and it is not too big. The only thing is, it is really hard to put it back into its original bag, other than that it's great. I will up date after my trip.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa

customer_reviews.title: If you're 6'4" this is the one you want
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to dislike it because I'm super picky about my camping gear. But... I have to say this impressed me so far. I'm 6'4" and don't fit in many things but I had extra room. My belly, being 42", could use a bit more space. But it's not your fault I need to lose some weight. I have a camping trip coming up in a couple weeks so I will have a final review then. So far I will say just in trying it out it was soft and comfy, if a little warm (which I won't complain about. The only gripe I have is the compression bag. It won't last long.
customer_reviews.author: John Mansell

customer_reviews.title: Good thus far
customer_reviews.text: I just received the sleeping bag yesterday! Already love it because it is definitely lightweight. I bought this for an upcoming trip (next month). I am going backpacking and need ultralight things because I need to hike 10 miles into the campground. I will be updating my review after my trip but so far I really like it. I open the sleeping bag and I love it how the compression bag to put the sleeping bag is separated from the sleeping bag itself. I know some brands the little bag is attached to the bag.
customer_reviews.author: Cristina

customer_reviews.title: Great product!!!
customer_reviews.text: This sleeping bag is great! First, I love the color. Secondly, I was in it for under 5 minutes and it immediately warmed me up. The quality is great and it has a nice hooded portion of you want to keep your ears and head warm. This sleeping bag gets an A+ and I would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Kristie

customer_reviews.title: Great lightweight bag to freezing level.
customer_reviews.text: Used for occasional backpacking trips. Held up well in a hammock on the first trip. It was about 40 on the last trip and it was plenty warm. Not so sure about the 20 degree rating, but I would say good to freezing. Probably good with a pad under it.
customer_reviews.author: Naduals

customer_reviews.title: Too snug for me.
customer_reviews.text: Sleeping bag is very tight and uncomfortable. I weigh only 165 pounds and had three miserable nights in a tent camping in the Rocky Mountains recently.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn E. Fox

customer_reviews.title: Great Lightweight Sleeping Bag!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great sleeping bag! I was looking for something more lightweight and compact for a camping trip in Utah and this sleeping bag is everything I was looking for. Its very soft, comfortable, and breathable. I love how compact it gets in the compression sack. Its no bigger than a rolled up towel, which is great for attaching to my backpack while hiking. I would highly recommend this sleeping bag to anyone looking for a comfortable, lightweight sleeping bag that won't add weight to your gear!
customer_reviews.author: Nstark

customer_reviews.title: Good bag, bad hardware
customer_reviews.text: The sleeping bag itself is reasonably warming, I used this for a December backpacking trip and felt perfectly comfortable, but the zipper is very poorly crafted and design. I find myself having to "re-thread" the zipper every time I use it. Fits back into the stuff bag quickly and painlessly though. I'd recommend going with another option to be honest, the most crucial thing at the end of a long day is to be able to slip in and zip up quickly without having to writhe around a small backpacking tent trying to get the zipper back on track.
customer_reviews.author: Blair johnson

customer_reviews.title: Good bag bad stuff Sack!!
customer_reviews.text: The first thing I'd like to say is that I was really disappointed in how fast the stuff Sack ripped. I attempted to put it away and ripped the bottom out with very little effort :( As for the sleeping bag itself, I used it for rainy weather in the 32 to 42 degree range. I was wearing thin long John's, and stayed relatively warm throughout the night, except in the early morning, at which point I had to throw on another layer. I think it is better for the spring and fall times of the year around 50 degree. Overall I liked it though, with the exception of the stuff Sack.
customer_reviews.author: Tom S.

customer_reviews.title: Compressed small & tight
customer_reviews.text: This was my first experience with a compression sack, that was pretty cool. It really did make it smaller and it’s already lightweight. the videos on how to hold it tight to get it to roll up nice and small were very helpful. I did move around a little bit in the hammock and the fabric is a little bit slippery so I would have to move the sleeping bag with me-that might be normal, this is my first time in a hammock. By the way I slept great.
customer_reviews.author: christine

customer_reviews.title: Light, Packs Small & Well-Made at a Great Price
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, I’ve had plenty of sleeping bags from high-end hiking bags to cheap car camping bags. This is right there near the top... light weight, packs small, reasonably well made, and appropriately warm for the rated temperature. The difference between this and a high-end bag? They’re usually made with down. However, for the price, this is by far the best bag I’ve seen. It’s perfect for a summer hiking or biking trip.
customer_reviews.author: Billiam

customer_reviews.title: Cold, so Cold
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 3 of these sleeping bags. Pros: * Very Light weight * Easy to get into storage sack. * Lots of room to move around inside considering its a mummy bag. * Made packing up the car for camping a breeze Cons: *Zipper snags * I was VERY VERY cold using this sleeping bag. So much so that we had to cut our trip early. For my husband I purchased a zero degree bag that is HUGE, but oh so very warm. I immediately returned these bags and will be purchasing warmer ones. The lowest temp during our trip was 51 Degrees. So cold in this bag. Miserable.
customer_reviews.author: A.P.

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied customer
customer_reviews.text: It is rated 35-40 degrees First camping trip with it was upper 30's on the top of a mountain in TN. I wouldn't say that I was as warm as I wanted to be, but conditions were right against the limitations for this bag. Getting it zipped up completely was a little difficult, but once I did I was fairly comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Great bag much better than some other brands.
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with this sleeping bag so far. Weighed 2.8 pounds (I did remove the 2nd stuff sack before I checked it) it has 2 stiff sacks the larger is all I am using. The straps to compress the bag down are very well made (just bought another brand and the strap ripped out of the bag and keep coming out of the buckles) this bag seems much better made. The only issue I have is I'm 6'7" tall and the bag is a little short for me but I knew this when I ordered and I think it will work for me.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob L.

customer_reviews.title: Good size and kept me warm
customer_reviews.text: I am 6'3" and 225. Fairly athletic build and it fit me perfectly with just enough room. Really comfortable and I was able to sleep on my side. A bit snug on my side with my arms in but good. Was in 30 degree weather for 4 nights and had no problems at all. I put one hand warmer in one night and woke up sweating so try it out to find your comfort level. This was just right for me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable but slippery.
customer_reviews.text: We went camping on a very warm weekend. I fell asleep on top of it and didn't sweat at all. When the temperature grew colder, it provided the necessary warmth, but It still didn't make me sweat. I used it on top of a sleeping cot, so it moved around a lot. I used it on an air mattress the second night, with the same experience.
customer_reviews.author: emc2

customer_reviews.title: Warm, cozy sleeping bag!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this bag at the last minute for an impromptu trip into the mountains. I usually get cold at night when camping, so I was nervous that I wouldn't be warm enough. It was in the 30s and there were thunderstorms all night, but I stayed super warm and dry. I was so warm, I even used the vent at the bottom, it really works! I'm 5'10" and it was long enough/roomy enough, and the hood at the top kept my pillow in place. I was able to get mine back into the small stuff sack, but the second sack came in handy for packing up other things for the trip down the mountain. Great size for backpacking. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: jetcrash9

customer_reviews.title: Used For Fall Camping
customer_reviews.text: Great sleeping bag - it was warm and comfortable! I used it for a Fall camping trip in CO. The temp got down to 45-50 at night. Any lower, I probably would have needed a warmer bag, but this did great. I'm always cold, but I wore double layers at night and slept straight through. I was pleasantly surprised by this sleeping bag! I'd highly recommend this company and their products.
customer_reviews.author: MCHan

customer_reviews.title: I’d recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Went on a Colorado trip and camped for a few nights and this sleeping bag kept me warm and comfortable. I still had plenty of leg space and room to move (I move around a lot when I sleep). It got cold at night and it kept me warm, but I’m not sure that it would during a harsh winter. My favorite is the stuff sack that I can make smaller - makes it so much easier to put away and transport/storage it!
customer_reviews.author: David Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginner backpacking!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this sleeping back for some overnight hikes that I have planned in the spring. It’s very lightweight and I believe it will be perfect for a beginner like myself. I’m a fairly large guy and it is snug in some areas but I knew that would be the case before buying. There are certainly better and lighter bags but for the price this is perfect!
customer_reviews.author: JSis813

customer_reviews.title: great warm weather camping bags
customer_reviews.text: Love these little sleeping bags, they're a little bigger than I thought they'd be, they're about 9" x 20". still plenty small enough for what we're using them for, they're not overly heavy and I think if you were using them in the advertised conditions you might get cold. We use them in Hawaii and it doesn't usually get below 60 degrees so we've been super comfortable. even my wife who seems to be able to get cold while standing in the sun in the middle of the day. Overall great product!
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Jones

customer_reviews.title: Value for money
customer_reviews.text: It is comfortable, compresses down to a compact size and is light weight. It had a zipper problem though because of missing stitching in a particular place and so the zipper snags. However, the manufacturer agreed a give a 50% refund. So I decided to take it and adjust with a little bit of snag. Other than that I would say it's a good quality bag and pretty warm. An extra bag is also included with this product for free! I would definitely recommend this for hiking trips. A low temperature rating bag is also available but it's priced for more and heavier and bulkier than this one.
customer_reviews.author: Sarvesh Jadhav

customer_reviews.title: Best Quality I've Owned
customer_reviews.text: This was our first time experiencing ~40F weather while camping, and these sleeping bags were able to keep us warm and dry all night, no drafts coming through the zipper. We used sleeping mats under them and were insulated enough from the ground. I really enjoyed the hoodie feature. They are very light-weight and compact once they're in the stuff bag. My boyfriend is 6'2" and he had plenty of length to spare once zipped in. The stuff bag is a tight fit, but just keep at it and all will be well, don't even bother folding and rolling! I can see these lasting a lifetime of occasional use, perfect for what I need.
customer_reviews.author: Madison

customer_reviews.title: Horrible,  doesn't keep you warm.
customer_reviews.text: Worst sleeping bag ever! The fabric inside makes you feel sweaty and sticky but you are not warm. Temperature got down to about 45 and I was freezing. My husband felt the same. Another couple backpacking with us bought the same sleeping bag and it was the same for them so it wasn't just me. We hated it so much we didn't even want to go to bed the second night. Cannot return it past the return date. Horrible first backpacking trip! I guess you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Trump

customer_reviews.title: Zipper Issues, warm, light, great price!
customer_reviews.text: This was a warm bag when I used it. Night temps were around mid 40’s. The zipper only zips from the outside and snags every inch or so which makes it difficult to zip up when your in the bag. For the price you can’t beat the weight, size, and warmth of this bag. It was surprisingly larger than expected. I’m 5’9” and had about a foot of extra room. It was a little tight around the shoulders but I will be keeping this in my backpacking gear arsenal.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Met expectations
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this bag is awesome. Seems to be well made. I slept on a mattress in my car at the beginning of went when I went on a road trip and this bag was awesome...It was so awesome I slept with it in my bed for a week after that... It is super comfy and I think it meets the expectations that the description set.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan J Drake

customer_reviews.title: 2nd BAG IS TOO SMALL AND I HAD A STAIN ON MY BAG.
customer_reviews.text: The product came on time but when I received it I was greatly displeased. I found a dark stain on the front of the bag when I unfolded it. Then when I tried to fold it back in the small drawstring bag, it was too tiny that I had to put it in the first bag it came in.
customer_reviews.author: julia gonzales

customer_reviews.title: Warm and compact
customer_reviews.text: Nice and warm! I was able to use this before it got too cold outside with my hammock in the backyard. The carrying bag will take some stretching to get everything to fit easily, as it was very difficult to squeeze it all back into it. Maybe I could roll it a little tighter or have someone help me. All in all, a great insulated bag for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Trickee

customer_reviews.title: Greater starter sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: I needed a backpacking sleeping bag, this seem to do the trick. The bag is light enough and compacts to a small enough size. It comes with a compression bag, which is nice. My first night I thought it would be a good idea to leave the rain fly off to watch the stars Not a good idea, it got pretty cold (I don't know how cold, but my battery pack felt like ice). The bag kept me warm. I'm on the shorter size, so I can't speak to it's length. Overall for it's price, weight and size it's a great starter sleeping bag.
customer_reviews.author: albert john parks

product_meta.title: WINNER OUTFITTERS Mummy Sleeping Bag with Compression Sack, It's Portable and Lightweight for 3-4 Season Camping, Hiking, Traveling, Backpacking and Outdoor
feature_bullets: High-quality material: 350T Polyester with coating shell makes the sleeping bag ultra soft, waterproof and rip-stop, So it can keep you warm even in extreme weather and prevent you from any dampness. Comes with 200G/㎡ Hollow Fiber fill which enhances non-allergetic, pro-environmental and better insulating performance. You'll feel comfortable when temperature is between 35F and 40F. But these are designed to keep the average sleeper warm even at near-freezing temperatures(20F).

Two Sack Note:Our compression sack and sleeping bag load in one random color stuff sack,when you get the sleeping out, you will find the compression sack.Skin-Friendly & Easy to Clean: The bag has 350T polyester lining which is skin-friendly and soft, you feel very comfortable and sleep like kids or baby when you lie in it.Our sleeping bags are also extremely easy to clean as they are safer for machine wash too.

Lightweight & Portable: Thanks for the Mummy design, this sleeping bag weighs only 2.8 pounds. Mummy sleeping bag not only fit adult body very well, but also reduce extra weight. Moreover, each sleeping bag comes with a travel-friendly carry bag, a compression sack with straps, which makes it quite convenient to store and carry the sleeping bag along. It's really perfect for camping, hiking, travel & Outdoor Activities.

SBS zipper: With SBS double slider zipper, it can adjust the temperature according your demand. So the camping sleeping bag could be used in 3-4 season. SBS is the famous zipper company like YKK. Every zipper takes 120,000 times stretch test to make sure the performance. The bag has draft collars and zipper draft tubes, which could prevent warm lose and cold come in. Finally it enhance insulation performance with the draft tubes.

Holiday Gift Choice for Christmas, We provide detailed instructions for use and maintenance procedures in the pictures and description, if there are other problems, we will reply you in the first time.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
